ir:
For the payable constructor function.
- the state variable minbet will be updated to 0x16345785d8a0000.
- the state variable starttime will be updated to 0x5ca15480.
- the state variable roundtime will be updated to 60.
- the state variable walletpercent will be updated to 20.
- the state variable nextroundpercent will be updated to 15.
- the state variable jackpotpercent will be updated to 15.

For the claimOwnership function.
- For pendingowner:
  - the state variable owner will be updated to pendingowner. Afterthat, 
    - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to 0.

For the changeMinimalBet function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable minbet will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeJackpot function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable jackpot will be updated to the first argument.

For the transferOwnership function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable pendingowner will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeWallet function, it has one argument and its type is address.
- For owner:
  - the state variable wallet will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeStartTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable starttime will be updated to the first argument.

For the changeRoundTime function, it has one argument and its type is uint256.
- For owner:
  - the state variable roundtime will be updated to the first argument.

For the payable 0x00000064 function.
- the state variable walletpercent will be updated to the third argument.
- the state variable nextroundpercent will be updated to the second argument.
- the state variable jackpotpercent will be updated to the fourth argument.

For the payable fallback function.
- When GAS is greater than 0x249f0, and the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not smaller than minbet:
  - the state variable lastround will be updated to (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
  - the winner of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to caller.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is 0:
    - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
    - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
    - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
    - When (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is greater than 1, and the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is 0:
      - When the winner of lastround is not 0:
        - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
        - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
      - When the winner of lastround is 0:
        - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
        - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to jackpot.
        - it transfers ether valued 0 to wallet.
  - When the ether just received (i.e., msg.value) is not 0:
    - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)))-((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
    - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
    - it transfers ((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
    - it transfers ((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.
    - When (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is greater than 1, and the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is 0:
      - When the winner of lastround is not 0:
        - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)))-((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
        - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
        - it transfers ((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
        - it transfers ((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.
      - When the winner of lastround is 0:
        - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to ((((the ether just received (i.e., msg.value)+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)))-((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100))-((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)).
        - the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (((nextroundpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100)+the pool of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
        - it transfers ((jackpotpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to jackpot.
        - it transfers ((walletpercent*the ether just received (i.e., msg.value))/100) to wallet.
  - When (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is greater than 1, and the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) is 0:
    - the roundbalance of lastround will be updated to 0.
    - the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to (the pool of lastround+the roundbalance of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime))).
    - When the winner of lastround is not 0:
      - it transfers ether valued the roundbalance of lastround to the winner of lastround.
      - the state variable lastround will be updated to (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
      - the winner of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to caller.
    - When the winner of lastround is 0:
      - it transfers ether valued the roundbalance of lastround to wallet.
      - the state variable lastround will be updated to (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)).
      - the winner of (1+((current time-starttime)/roundtime)) will be updated to caller.

 Here are some state variables with their corresponding types: public state variable `owner` is typed address,public state variable `pendingowner` is typed address,public state variable `winner` is typed mapping,public state variable `roundbalance` is typed mapping,public state variable `minbet` is typed uint256,public state variable `starttime` is typed uint256,public state variable `roundtime` is typed uint256,public state variable `wallet` is typed address,public state variable `jackpot` is typed address,public state variable `pool` is typed mapping,public state variable `walletpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `nextroundpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `jackpotpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `lastround` is typed uint256.
 Here are some programming specifications: - You must declare a variable before you can use it, but the same variable cannot be declared twice
- You must lock the pragma and use a stable version (e.g., pragma solidity `0.6.12`).
- For exteranal calls, you must use `.call()` instead of `.transfer()` and `.send()`.
- The target address who receives ether must be `payable address` type.
- You must make the function `payable` if `msg.value` is used in the public functions.
- From security perspectives, you must check whether an overflow or underflow is possible before an arithmetic operation (e.g., safemath operations), and you should determine whether the user's address is empty before transferring ether to the him.
- You cannot import external resources because you are a separate contract.
- You must use the following methods in new versions rather than old methods
  - For some built-in functions, 
    - `abi.encodePacked(...) returns (bytes memory)` performs packed encoding of arguments to bytes.
    - `keccak256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the Keccak-256 hash of the input.
    - `sha256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the SHA-256 hash of the input.
    - `ecrecover(bytes32 hash, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s) returns (address)` recovers the address associated with the public key from elliptic curve signature or return zero on error. 
  - For some properties,
    - `block.number (uint)` returns the current block number.
    - `block.timestamp (uint)` returns the current block timestamp as seconds since unix epoch.
    - `blockhash(uint blockNumber) returns (bytes32)` returns the hash of the given block.

 Here are some state variables with their corresponding types: public state variable `owner` is typed address,public state variable `pendingowner` is typed address,public state variable `winner` is typed mapping,public state variable `roundbalance` is typed mapping,public state variable `minbet` is typed uint256,public state variable `starttime` is typed uint256,public state variable `roundtime` is typed uint256,public state variable `wallet` is typed address,public state variable `jackpot` is typed address,public state variable `pool` is typed mapping,public state variable `walletpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `nextroundpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `jackpotpercent` is typed uint256,public state variable `lastround` is typed uint256.
 Here are some programming specifications: - You must declare a variable before you can use it, but the same variable cannot be declared twice
- You must lock the pragma and use a stable version (e.g., pragma solidity `0.6.12`).
- For exteranal calls, you must use `.call()` instead of `.transfer()` and `.send()`.
- The target address who receives ether must be `payable address` type.
- You must make the function `payable` if `msg.value` is used in the public functions.
- From security perspectives, you must check whether an overflow or underflow is possible before an arithmetic operation (e.g., safemath operations), and you should determine whether the user's address is empty before transferring ether to the him.
- You cannot import external resources because you are a separate contract.
- You must use the following methods in new versions rather than old methods
  - For some built-in functions, 
    - `abi.encodePacked(...) returns (bytes memory)` performs packed encoding of arguments to bytes.
    - `keccak256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the Keccak-256 hash of the input.
    - `sha256(bytes memory) returns (bytes32)` computes the SHA-256 hash of the input.
    - `ecrecover(bytes32 hash, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s) returns (address)` recovers the address associated with the public key from elliptic curve signature or return zero on error. 
  - For some properties,
    - `block.number (uint)` returns the current block number.
    - `block.timestamp (uint)` returns the current block timestamp as seconds since unix epoch.
    - `blockhash(uint blockNumber) returns (bytes32)` returns the hash of the given block.
- `0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` means `-1`, so `+0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff` indeed means `-1`.
